normalization

Class Relation

  • java.lang.Object
    • normalization.Relation

  • public final class Relation
extends java.lang.Object
    The Relation class represent a relation consisting a set of attributes and a set of FD's
    Author:
    SUN XIMENG (Nathaniel)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Relation(java.util.Set<Attribute> attrs, java.util.Set<FuncDep> fds)
      The default constructors
      Relation(java.lang.String[] names, java.lang.String[] exprs)
      Quickly construct a Relation object with two string arrays
      Relation(java.lang.String names, java.lang.String exprs)
      Quickly construct a Relation object with two formatted strings, one for attributes and another for FD's

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Set<Relation> decomposeTo3NF()
      Decompose the current relation into a set of relations that satisfy 3NF, by using the Lossless Join & Dependency Preservation algorithm
      java.util.Set<Relation> decomposeToBCNF()
      Decompose the current relation into a set of relations that satisfies BCNF, regardless the possible loss of FD's
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
      A Relation object will equal to another if and only if: 1) they have exactly the same set of attributes; 2) they have exactly the same set of FD's
      java.util.Set<Attribute> getAttributes() 
      java.util.Set<FuncDep> getFdsViolating3NF() 
      java.util.Set<FuncDep> getFdsViolatingBCNF() 
      java.util.Set<FuncDep> getFuncDeps() 
      java.util.Set<java.util.Set<Attribute>> getKeys()
      Compute all the candidate keys in this relation
      java.util.Set<java.util.Set<Attribute>> getSuperkeys()
      Compute all the superkeys (including candidate keys) in this relation
      int hashCode() 
      boolean is3NF() 
      boolean isBCNF() 
      java.lang.String toString()

        getClass, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Relation

        public Relation(java.util.Set<Attribute> attrs,
                java.util.Set<FuncDep> fds)
        The default constructors
        Parameters:
        attrs - a set of attributes
        fds - a set of FD's

      • Relation

        public Relation(java.lang.String names,
                java.lang.String exprs)
        Quickly construct a Relation object with two formatted strings, one for attributes and another for FD's
        Parameters:
        names - a string formatted as the following example: "name, application, date, gender"
        exprs - a string formatted as the following example: "a, b --> c; d --> e, f"

      • Relation

        public Relation(java.lang.String[] names,
                java.lang.String[] exprs)
        Quickly construct a Relation object with two string arrays
        Parameters:
        names - each element will be used as the name of an Attribute object
        exprs - each element is formatted as the following example: "a, b --> c, d"

    • Method Detail

      • decomposeTo3NF

        public java.util.Set<Relation> decomposeTo3NF()
        Decompose the current relation into a set of relations that satisfy 3NF, by using the Lossless Join & Dependency Preservation algorithm
        Returns:
        a set of decomposed relations

      • decomposeToBCNF

        public java.util.Set<Relation> decomposeToBCNF()
        Decompose the current relation into a set of relations that satisfies BCNF, regardless the possible loss of FD's
        Returns:
        a set of decomposed relations

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        A Relation object will equal to another if and only if: 1) they have exactly the same set of attributes; 2) they have exactly the same set of FD's
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • getAttributes

        public java.util.Set<Attribute> getAttributes()
        Returns:
        a set of Attribute objects that appear in this relations

      • getFdsViolating3NF

        public java.util.Set<FuncDep> getFdsViolating3NF()
        Returns:
        all FD's that violate the 3NF; an empty set if it's already in 3NF

      • getFdsViolatingBCNF

        public java.util.Set<FuncDep> getFdsViolatingBCNF()
        Returns:
        all FD's that violate the BCNF; an empty set if it's already in BCNF

      • getFuncDeps

        public java.util.Set<FuncDep> getFuncDeps()
        Returns:
        a set of FuncDep objects that involved in this relation

      • getKeys

        public java.util.Set<java.util.Set<Attribute>> getKeys()
        Compute all the candidate keys in this relation
        Returns:
        a set of candidate keys, and each itself is a set of attributes

      • getSuperkeys

        public java.util.Set<java.util.Set<Attribute>> getSuperkeys()
        Compute all the superkeys (including candidate keys) in this relation
        Returns:
        a set of superkeys, and each itself is a set of attributes

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object

      • is3NF

        public boolean is3NF()
        Returns:
        true if this relation is already in the third normal form (3NF)

      • isBCNF

        public boolean isBCNF()
        Returns:
        true if this relation is already in Boyce-Codd normal form (BCNF)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
